trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Thirdlight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Thirdlight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Thirdlight with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Thirdlight with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Thirdlight.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Thirdlight.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Thirdlight single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Thirdlight single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Thirdlight will be able to single sign into the application at your Thirdlight company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Thirdlight will be able to single sign into the application at your Thirdlight company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Thirdlight
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Thirdlight

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Thirdlight.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Thirdlight.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Thirdlight.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Thirdlight.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Thirdlight, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Thirdlight, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ThirdLight</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ThirdLight</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Thirdlight with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Thirdlight with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Thirdlight requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Thirdlight requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Thirdlight application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Thirdlight application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Thirdlight page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Thirdlight page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Thirdlight Sign In URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your Thirdlight application (e.g.: "http://azuresso2.thirdlight.com/"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Thirdlight Sign In URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your Thirdlight application (e.g.: "http://azuresso2.thirdlight.com/"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Thirdlight page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Thirdlight page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Thirdlight company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Thirdlight company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Configuration \> System Administration, and then click SAML2.
trans-unit.target: Go to Configuration \> System Administration, and then click SAML2.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>System Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>System Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML2 configuration section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML2 configuration section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML2 Single Sign-On.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML2 Single Sign-On.

trans-unit.source: As Source for IdP Metadata, select Load IdP Metadata from XML.
trans-unit.target: As Source for IdP Metadata, select Load IdP Metadata from XML.

trans-unit.source: Open the downloaded metadata file, copy the content, and then paste it into the IdP Metadata XML textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open the downloaded metadata file, copy the content, and then paste it into the IdP Metadata XML textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save SAML2 settings.
trans-unit.target: Click Save SAML2 settings.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Thirdlight, they must be provisioned into Thirdlight.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Thirdlight, they must be provisioned into Thirdlight.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Thirdlight, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Thirdlight, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Thirdlight company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Thirdlight company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Users tab.
trans-unit.target: Go to Users tab.

trans-unit.source: Select Users and Groups.
trans-unit.target: Select Users and Groups.

trans-unit.source: Click Add new User button.
trans-unit.target: Click Add new User button.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Username, Name or Description, Email, Choose a Preset or Group of New Members of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Username, Name or Description, Email, Choose a Preset or Group of New Members of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Thirdlight user account creation tools or APIs provided by Thirdlight to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Thirdlight user account creation tools or APIs provided by Thirdlight to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Thirdlight **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Thirdlight **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
